text.title: ENZON ENZN SAYS DRUG TREATS DISEASE
text.body: Enzon Inc new treatment using investigational new drug PEG ADA restored functioning immune system first two children were born deficient enzyme adenosine deaminase disorder known as severe combined immunodeficiency disease or bubble boy disease Bubble Boy Disease rare but severe disease hampers development immune system killed most victims before adulthood Children disease consigned to live sterile environment such as plastic bubble to avoid infection company study Enzon s drug conducted at Duke University showed two children suffering disease were treated seven months respectively were free serious infection during time company results were published New England Journal Medicine disease caused by missing enzyme called Adenosine Deaminase or ADA crucial to development immune system Enzon developed technology to coat enzyme substance called polyethylene glycol or PEG serving to disguise enzyme when reintroduced into body preventing rejection Marked improvement laboratory tests immune function occurred each child along increase number T lymphocytes immune cells were missing before treatment PEG ADA begun study The children now more active begun to gain weight height Before treatment their growth been very poor comparison to normal children same age study conducted by Doctors Michael Hershfield Rebecca Buckley PEG ADA injections were given once week Victims disease traditionally been treated by bone marrow transplants but most donors available or transplantation unsuccessful company Other diseases caused by missing enzyme might also be treated by introducing PEG coated enzyme article noted

reuters.unknown: C G L M T f reute r f BC Trade

text.title: CONGRESS MAY CURB U S AID TO DEVELOPMENT BANKS
text.body: Congressional ire rising against multinational development banks make loans to help other countries produce goods direct competition beleagured U S farmers miners record U S trade deficit billion dlrs year farm economy doldrums Congress pressing to hold back U S funds World Bank other development banks if money used to subsidize production or to produce goods already oversupply around world American tax dollars being used to subsidize foreign agriculture mineral production often direct competition our producers Senator Don Nickles Oklahoma Republican letter to fellow senators seeking support his legislation to limit these loans Nickles Senator Steven Symms conservative Republican Idaho introduced legislation strictly limit U S funding multinational development banks if they make any loans to help developing countries produce surplus commodities or minerals Current law requires United States vote against such loans but carries no reprisals if they ultimately approved by banks Treasury Secretary James Baker s assurances U S policy to oppose these loans did satisfy concerns raised at two Senate committee hearings week Baker told Senate Appropriations subcommittee on Foreign Operations As policy matter we oppose loans production commodities oversupply senators cited mln dlr World Bank loan made to Argentina year to help increase agricultural exports by one billion dlrs year by Nickles Symms others also cited other loans such as World Bank loan to Hungary to expand livestock exports dlrs lent to Thailand to at low interest rates agriculture year Republican controlled Senate voted three times over objections administration to cut U S funding development banks by amount these loans But even to vote favour proposal restrictions were weakened final version Only provision directing U S officials to vote disapproval cleared Congress year s version called Foreign Agricultural Investment Reform FAIR Act require U S to vote against loans designed to increase production surplus commodities minerals Also recipient countries to prove production marketing export commodities could be handled without government subsidy If loan approved over U S objections United States increase or replenish funds institution until agrees to stop making such loans Objections to such loans most often been raised by conservative Republicans who traditionally opposed U S funding these international development banks But loss many jobs to foreign competition raised similar concerns among more moderate senators administration opposes any legislation tie hands votes on loans argues there might be instances country needed money to continue moves toward U S policies other areas Baker United States continue to use leverage banks to require foreign trade liberalization measures often form elimination subsidies Two House Republicans Representatives Larry Craig Idaho Beau Bolter Texas introduced bill But faces stiff opposition House Banking Committee blocked consideration by House past Symms intends to offer bill as amendment to any related legislation year aide

text.title: BANKERS WELCOME SPANISH RESERVE REQUIREMENT HIKE
text.body: Bankers welcomed Bank Spain s decision to raise reserve requirement banks savings banks saying reflected socialist government s determination to ease up fight against inflation despite painful social effects four years austerity central bank night raised requirement by one percentage point to pct March saying excess liquidity threatened money supply inflation targets Bankers move represented change tactic by Bank until now relied on raising interest rates to choke off money supply growth I think s good measure senior foreign banker It s faster way to get job done than using interest rates avoids unpleasant effects on other areas economy It shows political very strong They know controlling inflation make industry more competitive bring down unemployment long run he added head another foreign bank only month ago Bank Spain dismissed his suggestion rise reserve requirements preferring to pursue strategy raising interest rates But bankers high real interest rates on offer now around eight pct overnight funds attracting money abroad strengthening peseta making Spanish exports less competitive government says industry s competitiveness also being hit hard by inflation At pct year rate way above Spain s major trading partners European Community joined year ago To help meet year s target five pct insisting pay rises stay at level setting stage clashes trade unions who say they made enough sacrifices Demonstrations by workers students farmers whose demands essentially involve more government spending become almost daily occurrence But Prime Minister Felipe Gonzalez insists state doing as much as can Bankers reserve requirement increase could some impact on commercial lending rates but should hit money market too hard Bank Spain only yesterday raised key overnight call money rate to pct left unchanged at today s auction rate been increased nine times since start year when below pct Bankers commercial lending rates were set to rise any case end six pct maximium interest rate banks can offer time deposits up to six months measure take effect tomorrow following publication decree today s official gazette Bankers say liberalisation increase cost funds inevitably push lending rates higher companion measure reducing proportion funds banks must invest specific areas also takes effect tomorrow Officials when cut approved month aimed partly at compensating banks higher interest rates

text.title: EC DAIRY OUTPUT ACCORD PAVES WAY FOR MORE REFORM
text.body: Officials diplomats EC farm ministers who earlier week ended another marathon negotiating session achieved more than ever before fight to end food surpluses delighted EC officials now preparing to carry reform offensive into other areas Their immediate aim to drain wine olive oil lakes level grain mountain brought Community so much unwelcome publicity Earlier week ministers finally agreed after hours negotiations fine details outline accord to cut milk output by pct over two years reduce butter stocks now at record tonnes Officials new rules place strict limits on farmers rights to benefit high subsidised prices could be expected to reduce sales into intervention to trickle pave way reform other surplus sectors deal reached despite determined attempts at backsliding by some states as implications original outline accord reached December began to sink Despite coming under tremendous pressure ministers never wavered main features deal one senior official adding result augured well talks later month on other reforms Commission leading fight against food surpluses now proposed most severe annual price review at ministers fix farm support prices EC s history Most prices be cut or frozen new quality standards enforced most farmers rights to sell to intervention curtailed Officials say measures could lead to effective price cuts some low quality cereals eight to pct EC Commissioner Frans Andriessen currently working on proposals to provide direct income aids to farmers to cushion them worst effects restrictive price policy encourage ministers to swallow reform pill

reuters.unknown: F f reute h f BC Trade

text.title: CONGRESS EYES LOANS THAT AID U S COMPETITORS
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank Reuters
text.body: Congressional ire rising against multinational development banks make loans to help other countries produce goods direct competition beleagured American farmers miners record trade deficit billion dlrs year farm economy doldrums Congress pressing to hold back U S funds World Bank other development banks if money used to subsidize production or to produce goods already oversupply around world American tax dollars being used to subsidize foreign agriculture mineral production often direct competition our producers Sen Don Nickles Oklahoma Republican letter to fellow senators seeking support his legislation to limit these loans Nickles Sen Steven Symms conservative Republican Idaho introduced legislation strictly limit U S funding multinational development banks if they make any loans to help developing countries produce surplus commodities or minerals Current law requires United States to vote against such loans but carries no reprisals if they pass anyway Treasury Secretary James Baker s assurances U S policy to oppose these loans did satisfy concerns raised at two Senate committee hearings week Baker told Senate Appropriations subcommittee on Foreign Operations as policy matter we oppose loans production commodities oversupply senators cited dlr World Bank loan made to Argentina year to help increase agricultural exports by one billion dlrs year by Nickles Symms others also cited other loans such as World Bank loan to Hungary to expand livestock exports dlrs lent to Thailand to at low interest rates agriculture Baker Argentine loan really only one you can point to criticize year Republican controlled Senate voted three times over objections administration to cut U S funding development banks by amount these loans Even favorable vote to restrictions were weakened final version Only provision directing U S officials to vote disapproval enacted into law year s proposal called Foreign Agricultural Investment Reform FAIR Act require U S to vote against loans designed to increase production surplus commodities minerals Also recipient countries to prove production marketing export commodities could be handled without government subsidy If loan approved over U S objections United States increase or replenish funds institution until agrees to stop making such loans Objections to such loans most often been raised by conservative Republicans who traditionally opposed U S funding these international development banks But loss many jobs to foreign competition raised similar concerns among more moderate senators Democratic senator Barbara Mikulski Maryland told Baker at Senate Appropriations subcommittee hearing Many say banks financing competition American jobs She recommended United States use participation debt forgiveness developing country loans as wedge to open markets to U S goods administration opposes any legislation tie hands votes on loans argues there might be instances country needed money to continue moves toward U S policies other areas Baker United States continue to use leverage banks to require foreign trade liberalization measures often form elimination subsidies

text.title: BRITAIN SEEMS SET FOR NEW CASH ROW WITH EC
text.author: By Youssef Azmeh Reuters
text.body: Britain appeared set new cash row European Community partners as evidence emerged could be much worse off as result new proposals to radically alter way EC financed Analysis by officials diplomats proposals released yesterday by EC s executive Commission showed their full impact were they force year left Britain worse off by European Currency Units proposals to be agreed unanimously by member government after debate expected to open next month Commission they were necessary to prevent EC sliding once again into bankruptcy described current financing system as unfair unacceptable British dissatisfaction cost EC membership long been source friction diplomats proposals could well reopen wound despite proposed correction Britain s budget contribution to reflect inability to take full advantage EC s farm subsidies system because relatively small size agricultural sector Diplomats although other nations such as Italy Belgium Netherlands were certain to oppose elements system could also substantially increase their own EC payments main opposition expected Britain Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher made clear recent statements she prepared to abandon present system under Britain refunded two thirds net payments to EC unless fairer system devised diplomats Thatcher unlikely to consider proposed system as fair Commission s proposals base state s contribution on gross national product commission says fairer measurement reflecting relative wealth main element previous system share value added tax collected member states mechanism to compensate Britain inability to take up higher proportion EC farm expenditure to be paid by other states Commission also proposed to end repayments to all states service charge paid to them collecting customs duties on behalf EC

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC SHAD SEES PROGRESS ON

text.title: SHAD SEES PROGRESS ON INSIDER TRADING
text.body: Securities Exchange Commission chairman John Shad progress being made stopping insider trading but chairman House subcommittee jurisdiction over securities laws he concerned conditions on Wall Street Greed created feeding frenzy on Wall Street process laws broken multi billion dlr corporations become easy prey Rep Edward Markey D Mass chairman Telecommunications Finance at start hearing on SEC activities Congress understandably nervous We perceive current scandals as warning even worse things to come Markey The frenzy disruption created by merger mania particularly distressing Shad recent cases involving Ivan Boesky Dennis Levine others warning those who engage insider trading were taking heavy risk imprisonment high fines disbarment securities industry Insider trading been eradicated but been inhibited multimillions dollars profits Boesky others been siphoning off markets now flowing through to legitimate investors traders Shad his statement Shad insider trading cases involved only pct or less SEC enforcement actions recent years but they increased significantly to cases brought during past five years compared to cases preceeding years Markey he did favor banning takeovers but thought tender offer process needed reform including earlier disclosure takeover attempts N J Rep Mathew Rinaldo senior subcommittee Republican he introducing legislation to create five member commission to study securities industry year report findings recommendations to Congress Commission members be appointed by SEC Its primary mission be to analyze extent illegal trading on insider trading to assess adequacy existing surveillance systems government oversight operations commission advise Congress as to what additional resources or civil or criminal remedies needed to combat fraud improve compliance federal laws Rinaldo

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC FINNISH TAXATION MAJO

text.title: FINNISH TAXATION MAJOR ISSUE IN ELECTION CAMPAIGN
text.author: By Peter Verschoor Reuters
text.body: Personal taxation emerged as major economic issue Finnish general elections later month Conservative gains could mark shift towards indirect taxation accelerate moves towards more market oriented banking practices economists say Opinion polls indicate Conservative Party Finland s second largest may gain enough clout after elections to join coalition government still likely to be dominated by Social Democrats Prime Minister Kalevi Sorsa But economists point out Conservative economic policies differ only slightly governments trade Soviet Union be affected Helsinki bankers new government including Conservatives first time years could bring shift direct to indirect taxation present coalition Social democrats Centrists embarked on tax reform programme to cut marginal taxation up to pct highest income scales opposition also called reforms but they differ over how to regain lost state revenues One Conservative favoured possibility abolishing tax exemption on interest bank deposits government bonds Hannu Halttunen Helsinki bank Kansallis Osake Pankki KOP told Reuters We want to be more free setting interest rates creating different deposits to suit individual investors If tax on interest introduced then we prefer system taxation real interest gains Under present laws bank customers exempted tax on interest when banks jointly set interest rates Bankers encouraged cartel style banking hindering tougher inter bank competition London based Nordic banking expert liberalisation too strong word to use Finnish context but Conservative presence could dislodge traditional practices It probably result new practices been seen elsewhere few years growing rather more quickly Finland he reference to money market instruments All parties especially Conservatives been careful to avoid making Finnish Soviet trade election issue Moscow Finland s largest trading partner Until few years ago Conservative Party seen as anti communist but now moderated stance political analysts say Trade between Helsinki Moscow based on barter system balanced under long term accords January two countries signed agreement worth billion markka but trade past two years been declining due to fall price crude oil accounts pct Finnish imports Soviet Union bankers taxation become major economic theme campaign because there were few other issues Inflation pct compared pct unemployment increased slightly pct workforce to year s levels pct Social democrats doubled country s foreign trade surplus compared billion markka to billion markka Opinion polls say Sorsa s Social Democrats remain largest party seat Parliament some pct vote They currently hold seats Centre Party other major coalition partner also expected to hold on to seats But increased Conservative support decline Communists could make force Sorsa to allow Conservatives into government They currently hold seats

text.title: ANTIBIOTICS IN FEED AID DEADLY BACTERIA STUDY
text.body: A study salmonella poisoning uncovered new evidence common practice feeding antibiotics to cattle helping to create deadly bacteria can infect humans resist medicines Researchers at federal Centers Disease Control tracked spread unusual strain salmonella resistant to drug chloramphenicol were able to link resulting food poisoning to farms used drug to promote growth cattle Cattlemen often give their animals constant supply antibiotics feed to help them grow faster But critics been warning years constant exposure to drugs helping bacteria learn to resist drugs Industry officials disputed saying diseases develop resistance cattle probably do affect humans But new study reported Thursday s New England Journal Medicine shows diseases can spread to humans research team led by Dr John Spika number people who developed chloramphenicol resistant infection Los Angeles County alone jumped to following year Two those victims died half victims their study patients to be hospitalized their illness They also discovered cooking meat didn t always prevent disease Only pct victims reported eating raw infected hamburger Thus researchers concluded the majority cases appear to been caused by eating hamburger at least partially cooked researchers results show food animals major source antimicrobial resistant salmonella infections humans these infections associated antibiotic use on farms

text.title: DUTCH GROWTH LIKELY TO SLOW JOBLESS RISE IN
text.author: By Raymond Gijsen Reuters
text.body: Leaks major Dutch official economic forecast due to be published on Monday indicate reduced economic growth renewed rise unemployment year political market sources say Concern over anticipated fall Dutch competitiveness year against background average pct wage increase zero inflation firm guilder triggered some calls change monetary policy to help boost growth But whatever government s response central bank stick to policy keeping guilder firm they say official forecasting agency Centraal Planbureau CPB publishes outlook at start week also see key parliamentary debate on government finances economy Merchant bank Pierson Heldring en Pierson estimate reflecting general sentiment month Dutch economic growth now seen around one pct Domestic consumer spending expected to offset decline export growth caused by slowing growth West Germany main Dutch trading partner lower dollar Pierson February economic outlook latest growth forecasts well below to two pct growth figure seen by CPB early month forecasts pct economic growth made September fall unemployment bottoming out government already admitted meet goal reducing unemployment by annual to Some analysts industry leaders questioned central bank policy pegging guilder firmly to mark if necessary keeping interest rates up to support guilder Employers federation NCW chairman Fred Lempers criticised guilder s revaluation line West German mark January s European Monetary System EMS realignment expressed concern over effect on competitiveness But employers federation VNO noted Dutch economy become more competitive since fall dollar affecting gain more than EMS realignment Some analysts also question central bank s decision to copy latest Bundesbank discount rate cut instead lower money market rates abolish credit quota surcharge Central bank president Wim Duisenberg defended move saying bank adjusted rates most impact on money market noting the pct discount rate at moment most important Dutch rate because already far below market rates Central bank officials say heavy dependence on trade Dutch economy requires stable exchange rate interest rate policies serve goal Analysts noted large capital outflow Netherlands recently as foreign investments Dutch stock being sold to take profits Loosening tie between guilder mark reduce international confidence guilder make more dificult to attract foreign capital they noting Dutch interest rates rose sharply when guilder revalued completely line mark EMS realignment Many Dutch banks reacted favourably to decision to copy German discount rate cut but Pierson warned could actually add to uncertainty over guilder Some analysts noted friction between Finance Ministry central bank Finance Minister Onno Ruding having before Bundesbank discount rate cut he favoured lower Dutch rates but Germans should move first One analyst Ruding wanted to bring interest rates down to reduce government debt burden Finance Ministry spokesman lower interest rates were needed but denied any suggestion conflicting views between ministry central bank The cabinet s policy steady guilder to stay mark he

reuters.unknown: A f reute r f BC BANK OF ENGLAND RESIS

text.title: BANK OF ENGLAND RESISTS PRESSURE FOR RATE CUT
text.author: By Rowena Whelan Reuters
text.body: The Bank England again fought against money bond market pressure pre Budget interest rate cut leaving pound to take strain further rise trade weighted index to six month high closed at best level since September at pct value on index as foreign investors continued to buy into currency offers high relative returns possibility short term capital gains dealers Meanwhile opinion divided over whether Bank can stop cut before Budget Day March why should want to Bank s latest strong signal to market wants rates to stay steady moment came midafternoon when lent to discount houses at penal rate pct to relieve money market shortage They re really making discount houses suffer Stephen Lewis economist at brokerage house Phillips Drew Eleven three quarters pct way above money market rates money market signal apparently accompanied by any sterling sales on foreign exchanges talk inhibited strong rises yesterday Tuesday so buyers came strongly into pound pound surged to high dlrs at London close up previous finish at marks up If pressure keeps up There possibility rates could drop before Budget Jeremy Hale economist at finance house Goldman Sachs International Corp Some gilt traders forecasting half point cut base rate current pct as early as tomorrow However analysts Bank England need to be convinced present rise fundamental re rating rather than result short term speculative gains There valid reasons Bank to be cautious Peter Fellner U K Economist at brokers James Capel Co Markets become highly optimistic chances Conservative Party victory any early general election disappointment if Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher decides to hold back could lead to decline pound setback bonds Fellner election could be delayed until mid but most forecasts say be year Others note pound could yet prove vulnerable to oil price losses or change fortune dollar However analysts agree Bank largely trying to set timing cut than holding out against one altogether authorities traditionally prefer single sustainable rate move one way or other to half points here there Some add Bank be influenced by signs at least proportion latest bout sterling buying long term capital coming into London market notably Japan They argue pound being perceived as safer bet than dollar given latters recent sharp falls current political upheavals Washington Bank may want to see another few points on trade weighted index before Budget argued Lewis But by then sterling should be firm enough to satisfy even Bank England he added Bank declined to comment on reasons resisting pressure rate move before budget but banking sources authorities see recent rise sterling as more than just marking up by foreign exchange traders Meanwhile analysts noted market ignored potentially harmful news on trade front today s figures showing current account deficit billion stg above previous estimates current account deficit compares surplus billion stg Fellner under more normal conditions given bond currency markets pause but they were too bullish to worry such fundamentals guessing game over timing cut clearing banks divided as well as markets Privately some bank officials forecast Bank hold out at least week but at least one bank says rise possible tomorrow If move comes before March forecasts half point cut another half or full point Budget day

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC POLISH TRADE OFFICIAL

text.title: POLISH TRADE OFFICIAL CALLS FOR FREER MARKET
text.author: By Irena Czekierska
text.body: Deputy Foreign Trade Minister Janusz Kaczurba told Reuters Poland to diverge traditional Communist bloc centrally planned economic policies if wanted to bring economic renewal compete world markets Stressing his commitment to series reforms recently introduced to streamline economy boost export oriented industry he also called expansion role private sector Asked whether policies government advocating did represent departure strictly controlled economic model within Soviet bloc he interview Reuters I don t see any alternative but to try to proceed along lines economic reasoning He referred specifically to bankruptcies he be the logical outcome more stringent economic policy once state stopped propping up enterprises to guarantee jobs regardless how inefficient they were He added We should follow policy creating system whereby managers be really responsible overall economic effect enterprises can be done one way only through reduction subsidies But he also noted need to curtail bureaucracy branch ministries allow domestic prices to reflect world market make foreign exchange rates more realistic provide incentives to export oriented industry encourage private business Kaczurba talking to Reuters effect on economy U S Sanctions imposed response to suppression Solidarity trade union under martial law He acknowledged Poland s economic decline add to problems trying to regain markets support Western creditors even after Washington lifted remaining restrictions restored Most Favoured Nation trading status month Western officials say Polish goods to be more reuters.unknown: V RM f reute u f BC YEUTTER SAYS BUDGET C

text.title: YEUTTER SAYS BUDGET CUT KEY TO BETTER U S TRADE
text.body: A reduction U S federal budget deficit be needed to help eliminate nation s huge trade deficit U S trade representative Clayton Yeutter Speaking to New York Chamber Commerce Industry Yeutter Capital trade flows clearly inter releated now Unless we get budget deficit down we get trade deficit down He did elaborate on his views linkages between two deficits Private analysts financing large U S budget deficits requires heavy capital inflows overseas investors through purchases U S Treasury to lesser extent other U S securities as well We ll make some progress reducing billion dlr trade deficit but there s still long way to go Yeutter He problem must be approached on many fronts focus most strongly on U S overseas fiscal monetary policies to foster economic growth U S competitiveness establishment level playing field trade U S trade representative Federal Reserve under Chairman Paul Volcker done part to improve trade situation by getting interest rates down On fiscal side Yeutter the budget deficit still our biggest problem there been enough progress toward reducing deficit international area he our major trading partners could still do more to stimulate domestic growth Commenting on Japan running around billion dlr trade surplus United States Yeutter Japan just doing job on import side Yeutter declined to comment on statements relating to dollar made earlier today by Commerce Dept undersecretary Economic Affairs Robert Ortner Washington address to Export Import Bank sponsored meeting Ortner he believed dollar at current levels fairly priced against most European currencies but yen or pct undervalued The market determine dollar s proper value end Yeutter However he added if U S other nations do take necessary steps to cut U S trade deficit the dollar be equalizer Yeutter there no quick fix to trade problem any resort to such tactics as protectionist trade legislation or trade restrictions poses real dangers He there s relatively little Congress can do to legislate solution to trade problem Protectionist legislation only provoke retaliation by U S trading partners Yeutter There no doubt my mind willingness our trading partners to retaliate against unfair trade legislation Yeutter adding policy flexibility essential solving international trade problems

text.title: NEW CURRENCY PROBLEM SEEN AMONG U S EUROPE JAPAN
text.author: By Eric Hall Reuters
text.body: The highly visible drama involving yen s sharp rise against U S Dollar obscuring fact Japanese currency hardly budged against major European currencies thus creating new set exchange rate distortions Japanese European research officials officials looking beneath rhetoric statements by Group Five G industrial nations told Reuters currency movements past two years also creating fundamentally new world trade picture throwing up new trade tensions imbalances Trade figures show new currency alignments already changing Japan U S Trade axis into Japan European Community EC axis to discomfort Europe many ways least terms rare international cooperation September New York Plaza pact between U S Japan West Germany Britain France to cut down value dollar historic one But underlying peaks troughs major currency movements lay bare real picture Plaza pact appears as event prime importance but necessarily central significance officials officials when Plaza agreement took place dollar already on way down agreement simply helped on way Senior EC financial expert Tokyo Tomas de Hora watched movements closely You to look at dollar s peak compared now well before Plaza he On February dollar peaked against yen at yen On September Friday before Plaza Since then despite massive Bank Japan intervention periodic market frights further G concerted action dollar trend been down down down Yet ECU now around yen historical cross rates sterling mark tell much same story European currencies moving back up against yen close relationship between exchange rates trade flows makes difficult to see driving but undoubtedly trade equation between big three changing Japanese imports exports EC both grew by around pct dollar terms five pct yen gave Japan billion dlr trade surplus January Japanese exports to EC totalled half sales to U S against third recent years Trade U S rose pct exports pct imports dollar terms but fell pct exports pct imports yen terms The basic meaning Europe Japanese firms tremendous interest exporting to Europe where every unit sold maximises profits yen terms what important to them Suddenly instead U S Europe laying golden egg de Hora EC worried EC business also remarkable year Japanese sales but can be explained partly due to start small base compared total Japan U S Trade Japanese think EC firms now more competitive than U S Firms factor aggravating exchange rate imbalance cause problems This currency alignment between Japan EC reflecting excellent performance EC countries But therefore Japanese goods may keep their price competitive edge Azusa Hayashi Director First International Economic Affairs Division Foreign Ministry If you want my objective view I don t expect drastic improvement our trade imbalance year we asked moderation exports year we may to do so again he

text.title: HUGHES HT CHANGES STANCE ON MERGER AFTER SUIT
text.author: by Cal Mankowski Reuters
text.body: A one billion dlr lawsuit pushed Hughes Tool Co into face on rejection proposed merger Baker International Corp BKO Wall Street analysts night Hughes planned merger Baker off Baker then filed suit seeking punitive damages Hughes calling off merger At midday today Hughes still interested merger analysts also Hughes may be worried troubles could make takeover candidate There speculation today Harold Simmons Dallas investor might try to acquire Hughes but Simmons told Reuters he interested Simmons he intends to file D Securities Exchange Monday reporting stake five pct or more some publicly traded company He declined to identify target other than to rule out Hughes One analyst another factor latest Hughes turnabout Borg Warner Corp BOR owns pct Hughes Borg Warner ex reuters.unknown: C G f reute d f BC INTEREST IN OPTIONS S

text.title: INTEREST IN OPTIONS STIRRED BY U S FARM PLANS
text.author: By Nelson Graves Reuter
text.body: In their search ways to cut spending on U S farm programs policymakers their advisers here citing trading options contracts as alternative to federal income price supports Critics costly federal farm programs maintain government could get out guaranteeing minimum support prices if farmers systematically used options contracts to protect themselves against vacillating market prices With agricultural options now available there less need government price support programs to provide price stability farmers Heritage Foundation conservative think tank recent position paper Washington no longer needs to restrict level variability commodity market prices Farmers others agribusiness can now achieve benefits price stability by trading option markets paper written by Clemson University professor Kandice Kahl Critics farm programs contend options offer benefits price support programs without entailing cost to taxpayers Kahl s paper urged farmers to buy put options order to obtain right to sell at particular price to private seller option contract This gives farmer guaranteed price but still allows him to profit higher market prices if they available by foregoing his option Kahl Interest promoting understanding options trading among farmers also been stirred Congress by proposed change agricultural policy effect exposing participants federal farm programs to fluctuations income subsidies proposal supported by Reagan administration cross section lawmakers allow farmers to receive at least pct their income subsidies regardless how much they planted Under current law farmers enrolled federal price stabilization programs receive income subsidies or deficiency payments equal to difference between set target price higher support price or market price so called decoupling plan or aim to curtail surplus production by eliminating requirement farmers plant order to receive deficiency payments Critics plan contend if scheme succeeded curbing surplus output market prices rise deficiency payments fall leaving farmers who chose to plant shrunken income subsidies no crops to sell Sen Rudy Boschwitz R Minn who been forefront efforts to decouple income support acreage plantings advocates replacing variable deficiency payment fixed gradually declining payment But many farm state lawmakers turned off by idea offering fixed subsidies to farmers who plant nothing Some congressional staff members they intrigued by notion having federal government subsidize purchase call options to help farmers hedge their income risk By buying call option farmer obtain right to buy commodity at particular price If market price rose above option price farmer could exercise option sell commodity on spot market making up most reduction deficiency payment aide to Boschwitz senator might offer legislation linking options decoupling but might to await results pilot project on futures options trading mandated by farm bill bill required USDA association Commodity Futures Trading Commission to conduct pilot program at least counties produce major program crops program only recently launched designed to encourage producers to participate futures options markets to ensure producers net returns fall below county loan level crops question

reuters.unknown: C G T M f reute d f BC BRAZIL DEBT SEEN PART

text.title: BRAZIL DEBT SEEN PARTNER TO HARD SELL TACTICS
text.author: By Brian Killen Reuters
text.body: Brazil s recent announcement suspension interest payments on billion dlrs foreign debt gave banking system jitters confirmed views among many international economists commodities analysts Brazil continue to flex trading muscles developing world s most indebted nation also most prolific exporter agricultural commodities such as coffee soybeans might maximize foreign exchange revenue by selling hard on world markets economists That sounds like reasonable strategy But there no way they can trade their way out situation Aldo Roldan Vice President International Services at Chase Econometrics Roldan told Reuters Brazil only to tackle problems satisfying domestic demand competing on glutted world markets but also to work to make position on foreign exchange markets more profitable Domestic costs increased due to inflation exporters same offsetting movement exchange rates Roldan Chase economist also commodities markets were depressed generally did appear very promising country like Brazil where pure commodities account some pct exports total value around billion dlrs But he added They always pretty aggressive they good foreign marketing channels Analysts key factor Brazilian trade be coffee even without background pressure foreign creditors world s largest producer expected to hit market year vengeance Negotiations between International Coffee Organization ICO members to re establish producer export quotas broke up earlier week major producers consumers accusing each other intransigence Brazil tolerate change ICO regulations others wanted changed one senior coffee dealer dealer who declined to be named Brazil wanted to preserve market share At end talks he Brazil hinted could sell more than anyone else others suffer Brazil be aggressive seller under any scenario but as yet there no sign unusually heavy Brazilian sales dealer If they do come into market at level go lower you could breach dollar ninety or eighty cents he New York coffee futures May delivery settled cents lower Thursday at cents lb while more distant deliveries fell six cent maximum trading limit President Brazilian Coffee Institute Jorio Dauster told press conference Rio de Janeiro today Brazil no set target coffee exports following breakdown ICO talks on export quotas Many economists analysts believe soybeans could be focus possible stepped up Brazilian marketing efforts They be more aggressive year than they ever been according to Richard Loewy analyst Prudential Bache Securities Inc Loewy believes foreign debt problem good crop plus difficulties storage help motivate selling Brazil soybean crop Brazilian farmers also need cash flow they can t afford to store crops he Chicago soybean complex been nervous some time large South American crops developing under near ideal conditions towards record yields We going to see very rapid decline earlier than usual year our U S exports Loewy Tommy Eshleman economist American Soybean Association ASA year s Brazilian soybean harvest could total tonnes versus year Marketings be very aggressive summer when prices usually high relative to rest year due to vulnerability U S crop to bad growing weather Another incentive to sell might be trade anticipation reduction U S government soybean loan rate offered to farmers who give crops as collateral Eshleman He there been some uncertainty year soybean loan rate acts as effective floor prices by keeping supplies away free market Farmers can forfeit their beans to government rather than repay loan We re getting into period when they Brazil starting to harvest starting to export Eshleman But he added be while before U S exports fall to below bushels week around bushels currently Jose Melicias research department Drexel Burnham Lambert Brazil be trying to export as much as can year because economic situation He debt situation major consideration The Brazilian government also does enough money to pay storage he added Asked if return to inflationary environment Brazil make farmers inclined to hold onto crops Melicias make big difference On other commodity markets Brazil s selling impact may be muted no matter need to generate capital Brazil faced poor sugar harvest could limit exports to world market analysts country may oversold be unable to honor export commitments plus higher domestic demand caused by consumer price subsidies on ethanol refined sugar give little room to stretch exports they Brazil s other major crop cocoa third year surplus Cocoa consumption basically flat year fell so I don t think they can start throwing out cocoa find many more markets one analyst If they come out as aggressive sellers market collapse they can t afford to do she added

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute u f BC U S MONEY GROWTH SLO

text.title: U S MONEY GROWTH SLOWS SHARPLY ECONOMISTS SAY
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: U S money supply growth slowing down rapidly some economists believe all three Federal Reserve s main monetary aggregates may even contracted February contraction unlikely to be major concern Fed especially as follow long period torrid growth but could give central bank extra leeway weeks ahead if decided relaxation monetary policy justified on account weakness economy M money supply week ended February reported today rose billion dlrs to billion but preliminary forecasts call drop next week around two billion dlrs monthly average January billion dlrs M makes up quarter M fifth M other components M such as money market deposit accounts small time deposits also falling stage set falls broader aggregates too economists say M been largely discredited because traditional link to economic growth disintegrated under impact falling interest rates banking deregulation But consistent behavior all three aggregates likely to impress Fed Ward McCarthy Merrill Lynch Economics Inc The Fed confidence aggregates when they re all sending same signal going to raise some eyebrows at Fed McCarthy Stephen Slifer Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc added We some very good looking monetary aggregate data s coming lot weaker than I thought economists were quick to caution one month s data prove nothing especially because money growth previously been so rapid M weeks grown at pct rate at pct rate past weeks Moreover some contraction M can probably be explained by shift funds savings vehicles into booming stock market thus indication slowdown business expansion But data raise tantalizing possibility bond markets slowdown money growth partly reflection weaker economy needs more Fed stimulus McCarthy noted slower money growth coincides signs economy losing momentum as quarter progresses Some economic indicators as rosy as they were month ago he noted He expects only five to six pct M growth March rises M M four pct Slifer sees stronger growth pct M five pct or less M M but rates still be moderate enough to encourage Fed to ease policy if gross national product first quarter proved to be weak You d certainly be more inclined to ease than you past There certainly nothing Fed s latest balance sheet however to suggest change policy already under way economists Discount window borrowings were line expectations at dlrs day Robert Brusca Nikko Securities Co International Inc argued easier Fed policy unlikely to do much to solve America s most urgent economic problem massive trade deficit Because possibility further dollar depreciation thus rising inflation may be needed to close trade gap Brusca I m prepared to be all optimistic bond market

text.title: BRAZIL S FUNARO WINS FEW PROMISES ON EUROPE TRIP
text.body: Brazilian Finance Minister Dilson Funaro night concluded week s tour European capitals having gleaned little way concrete support governments his country s attempts to find radical solution to debt payments crisis However banking sources noted existence considerable sympathy Brazil s position among most commercial bank creditors manifested widespread belief adopting hard line could only exacerbate problems while patience might pave way eventual reconciliation Brazil on February unilaterally suspended interest payments on billion dlr debt to commercial banks followed by moves related to around billion dlrs bank trade credit lines deposited by foreign banks institutions action been preceded by significant deterioration Brazil s balance payments situation final quarter along marked acceleration inflation Reserves dipped to below four billion dlrs Funaro central bank president Francisco Gros week visited Washington to explain Brazil s move to government officials agencies week they sought official support U K France Germany Switzerland Italy They now decided to extend their tour flying on Sunday to Tokyo to talk to government officials possible visit to Canada before they return home Funaro Gros so far confined their consultations to government representatives believing problems Brazil s billion dlr debt call political solution However banking sources noted their attempts to enlist support European U S Governments been met almost unanimously advice to talk first to banks counsel been coupled emphasis on need Brazil to present to creditors convincing economic programme U K Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson also recommending accord International Monetary Fund IMF advice Funaro subsequently rejected flatly

reuters.unknown: F f reute b f BC ATT T PROPOSES NEW

text.title: ATT T PROPOSES NEW SIMPLIFIED REGULATIONS
text.body: American Telephone Telegraph Co proposing new simplified approach to regulating long distance telecommunications market filing Federal Communications Commission ATT proposed replacing current rate return regulation simplified rules would eliminate many costs now imposed on customers while freeing ATT to introduce new services pricing options more swiftly filing comes one day after MCI Communications Corp firm seek immediate deregulation principal long distance competitor ATT Under approach outlined filing ATT commit to continue providing basic long distance services to all customers to maintain uniform nationwide prices all parts country unless granted regulatory approval to do otherwise Specifically ATT proposed FCC require company to file tariffs new interstate services price changes go into effect within days addition proposal calls reduction voluminous documentation ATT required to file each time introduces or changes long distance services new proposal place burden on challengers to demonstrate ATT s tariffs are unreasonable also require long distance companies to submit periodic reports to help regulators monitor competition industry Lawrence Garfinkel ATT s Vice President Marketing Services With filing we re suggesting regulators replace blanket approach to regulating ATT more finely tuned targeted approach

text.title: SOUTH AFRICA OPTIMISTIC ABOUT DEBT TALKS
text.body: South Africa s director general finance Chris Stals he optimistic reaching mutually acceptable agreement foreign bank creditors debt renegotiation talks scheduled to begin next month Stals country s chief foreign debt negotiator we busy finding out how they banks feel They all different opinions There no consensus But asked if he optimistic on agreement new debt repayment plan Stals replied yes telephone interview his Pretoria office He declined to comment further before major review interim debt agreement regarding moratorium on principal repayments on billion dlrs South Africa s billion dlr external debt agreement on moratorium some creditor banks expires on June We series discussions great number banks both bilaterally individually on foreign debt situation preparation April Stals He no date been set meeting declined to comment on published reports past few months banks may demand accelerated repayments Banking sources here only escalation South African political unrest increase foreign pressure on repayments Finance Minister Barend du Plessis month forthcoming talks South Africa give fair deal to all creditors but agree to unrealistic demands

reuters.unknown: F A RM f reute u f BC FEBRUARY U S JOBS GA

text.title: FEBRUARY U S JOBS GAINS SHOW STRONGER ECONOMY
text.author: by Kathleen Hays
text.body: Momentum th U S economy may be picking up given solid across the board increases February U S employment report economists U S non farm payroll employment rose February twice what financial markets expected follows gain January revised down previously reported increase Even if you look at January February together still much stronger report than consensus expectation market Allan Leslie Discount Corporation Economists stressed gains hours worked signal much larger gains February U S production income than previously forecast average work week rose hours to hours hours January average manufacturing work week rose hours to hours longest factory work week since November Commerce Department The gains manufacturing employment point to very large increase industrial production between pct Joe Carson Chemical Bank compares to pct gain January U S industrial production Peter Greenbaum Smith Barney Harris Upham Co Inc noted average wage rate increased to dlrs hour February dlrs January Combined increase hours worked means we ll get pretty healthy gain personal income vis a vis wage salary disbursement he Greenbaum February U S personal income should rise at least pct after being flat January He February employment gains consistent his firm s first quarter U S real gross national product growth forecast pct Economists agreed employment data were negative credit markets they signal healthier economy no easing Federal Reserve s monetary policy But most market need fear tighter policy either This report another reason Fed to consider easing Ray Stone Merrill Lynch Capital Markets Inc It gives them more room to address dollar situation he If they to nudge policy tighter they could do so but s most likely they ll sit wait The data been uniform Stone added Durable goods were weak January now employment strong January U S durable goods orders dropped pct followed by pct drop U S factory goods orders U S retail sales fell pct U S merchandise trade gap widened to billion dlrs Things just aren t adding up Steve Slifer Lehman Goverment Securities Inc Consumer spending capital spending goverment spending net exports data show very weak first quarter GNP growth one pct he The employment production data point to big inventory build up but s what we thought fourth quarter we only got pct GNP growth Manufacturing employment gained after falling January Economists estimated gain accounted by striking workers steel machinery industries returning to work Even so some economists manufacturing gains resulted improving trade outlook Jason Benderly Goldman Sachs Co noted U S trade picture improved fourth quarter as net exports grew at pct annual rate while rate increase imports fell to only six pct continues to improve first quarter Not only official statistics fourth quarter but evidence pick up orders overseas paper products chemicals high tech goods capital goods show trade improving Benderley The economy moving between extremes he Some reports going to look bad some good but first quarter GNP going to grow middle at three pct gain services employment comprised greater part February s employment gain Retail services employment rose February compared to gain January previously reported at Construction employment rose slim February But follows robust gain January revised down previously reported gain U S civilian unemployment rate unchanged February at pct means jobless rate stayed at pct three consecutive months lowest reading since March Commerce Department noted The Federal Reserve to be pleased report Carson This takes away Fed s flexibility to ease but there s no reason to tighten s way too early

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC BANK OF ENGLAND PRESS

text.title: BANK OF ENGLAND PRESSURE HOLDS BASE RATES
text.author: By Rowena Whelan Reuters
text.body: This week s Bank England resistance to strong market pressure lower interest rates succeeded holding bank base rates at pct But at cost threatening Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson s policy stated at end Paris Group Six meeting month he wanted to see sterling broadly stable then prevailing levels market sources Since then pound risen to pct on closing trade weighted index up pct imediately after Paris meeting up on day Today s peak at pct highest since August Treasury spokesman Lawson he neither wanted substantial rise or fall sterling question therefore how large rise he ready to see before acting Paul Temperton chief economist at Merrill Lynch Europe Ltd estimated government wanted to see trade weighted index pct Even after action over few weeks sterling s only just within striking distance range he Other analysts agree government probably some broad target range around area However they Lawson be prepared to see pound go higher at least short term despite risk loss export competitiveness cheaper prices on imports If Bank England keeps interest rates as they what s to stop going higher John Cox executive director EBC Amro Bank Ltd major operator on London foreign exchange market Cox estimates Bank England been active selling sterling over past few days despite lack general market talk such intervention helped keep below dlrs pound rose to dlrs yesterday February day after Paris meeting But Cox says government must be worried sterling heading toward marks be very concerned if holds around these levels He warned Bank may run risk missing interest rate boat If rates don t come down market say they ought to come down sell sterling he Most dealers agree there good deal hot money being invested sterling money simply attracted by high overnight or one week rates could flow out at equally short notice However authorities hope at least proportion buying reflects long term investment The thing they want to do reduce them rates to jack them back up again Richard Jeffrey economist at brokerage house Hoare Govett Ltd He half point cut ensure continued support sterling at least near term However most analysts still looking full point March Budget Day Bank must hold out until sees reaction to Budget Temperton Budget widely forecast to be vote winner run up to general election major factor behind current bullishness government bond currency markets Lawson wants to delay cut base rates until budget He wants to be crowned glory interest rate cut Ian Harwood economist at Warburg Securities equities arm Mercury International Group Speculation clearing bank might break ranks lead way lower were confounded today There excitement fall weekly Treasury Bill rate to pct pct Friday might mean Bank changed mind followed imposition penal lending rates pct on discount houses yesterday lowest since base rates were at pct early October However Bill rate pertaining to three months money banking sources market could take cut as guide to Bank s intentions on short term rates

text.title: CRUDE OIL PRICES UP AS STOCKS OUTPUT FALL
text.author: BY TED D AFFLISIO Reuters
text.body: U S crude oil prices rose above dlrs barrel week industry analysts price could rise another dollar as inventories fall OPEC keeping production down cash market there tight supply crude short transportation time to major refining centers Daniel McKinley oil analyst Smith Barney Harris Upham Co That could send prices cts to dollar higher he added U S benchmark crude West Texas Intermediate rose to dlrs barrel today rise dlrs week rally oil prices week came after prices fell February more than two dlrs high dlrs barrel Oil traders were pulling prices down on assumption oil stocks were building OPEC producing well above bpd quota but now both those assumptions come under question McKinley Yesterday International Energy Agency monthly report oil stocks OECD area or industrialized nations were drawn down by bpd during first quarter year IEA estimates draw oil stocks during first quarter year come largely oil companies whose inventory levels by April one be estimated tonnes or days consumption Industry analysts also estimate bpd draw stocks made by Shell Chairman Peter Holmes yesterday fed speculation other major companies were destocking Traders destocking come as result so called buyers strike kept refiners buying officially priced OPEC oil effort to get organization to offer discounts to official price This struggle between companies OPEC ultimate game chicken but be resolved relatively soon I imagine by middle month March general trading manager international oil company told Reuters telephone interview part OPEC moved to win game by cutting excess supplies market by reduction own output traders survey estimates OPEC output to be bpd week Also earthquake Ecuador yesterday led to suspend oil exports indefintiely force majeure shipments This reduce short haul availabilities by bpd almost immediately longer suspension continues larger draw stocks be companies expecting to be there McKinley International oil traders other short haul crudes such as North Sea Brent were also scarce because Asian refiners bought oil after absorbing lot readily available Mideast crudes earlier week If pattern continues then oil companies bid up price oil as they purchase their refineries trading managers at several companies told Reuters But there were skeptics who they wondered how long OPEC can retain unity if buyer resistance continues Stephen Hanke chief economist at Friedburg Commodity Management OPEC production lower because Saudi cut to bpd could spell trouble if gives other members incentive to exceed their quotas He added The Saudis be picking up tab other members who produce over their quota drain on Saudis continue forcing them to cut output maybe as low as bpd to support dlrs average price he added There also signs some OPEC crudes being sold spot market at below OPEC official prices traders Oil traders Nigerian Brass River sold delivery into U S Gulf at price related to North Sea brent traded week at dlrs far below official price dlrs similar quality Bonny Light Iranian oil also surfacing U S Gulf Far East at reported discounts to dlrs official price There lot oil priced on government to government deals below official prices probably being resold one international trader

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC ATT T PHONE PROPOSA

text.title: ATT T PHONE PROPOSAL TO HELP PROFITS
text.author: By Samuel Fromartz Reuters
text.body: American Telephone Telegraph Co s proposal to deregulate long distance phone service unlikely to produce radical change phone rates but should help company s profits analysts Deregulation mean more pricing discounts large volume users but status quo residential users PaineWebber Group analyst Jack Grubman But proposals scrap pricing formula constrained company s profits long distance business leading to higher profit margins analysts ATT long pushed deregulation long distance business profits been limited by regulated rate of return on company s investments rate cut year to pct Earlier today company proposed to Federal Communications Commission to scrap formula cut amount time needed to approve rate proposals leave up to competitors to oppose filings MCI Communications Corp MCIC made similar filing yesterday saying greater moves increase competition telephone business Analysts proposals allow ATT to cut costs long distance unit increase profit margins previously constrained by rate return But many they did expect proposals to lead to higher prices industry simply because competition phone industry giant faces You probably wouldn t see as much price decline Gartner Group analyst Fritz Ringling But you wouldn t see rise Grubman proposals allow ATT to selectively raise or lower prices depending on market It give ATT lot more flexibility he ATT now faces period comment number companies be able to respond to proposals FCC hearings may face at least one strong opponent U S Sprint long distance joint venture between GTE Corp GTE United Telecommunications Inc UT We think Congress FCC should establish reasonable rate return Someone should establish U S Sprint spokesman But he added company opposed to greater competition may also take some time proposals to go through process they may be altered by various constituencies affected by move There s so much complexity so much inertia so much bureacracy stricly speaking mechanisms won t happen fast analyst Victor Krueger Gartner Group

reuters.unknown: E RM A f reute u f BC CANADA S MOVE TO SHOR

text.title: CANADA S MOVE TO SHORTEN DEBT TERMS AIDS MARKET
text.author: By Russell Blinch Reuters
text.body: The government s move to pare huge financing costs by shortening debt maturities left more room other borrowers sparked lively market treasury bills senior market analysts Bank Canada Ottawa s fiscal agent marketplace revealed week sharply reduced borrowing needs allowed shift toward shorter bond terms heavier emphasis on weekly treasury bill auction issued terms up to one year The aggressive use treasury bill program meant government now able to maintain lower cash balances lower financing costs Bank Canada annual report released week government budget deficit financing requirements fall to billion dlrs fiscal year ending March billion dlrs prior year Projected fiscal requirements billion dlrs bank year s new government bond issues nearly two thirds were maturities less than years Greater use also made bond auctions to market new issues terms two to five year range Meanwhile treasury bills outstanding at year end totalled nearly billion dlrs increase billion dlrs over year billion dlrs since Although amount money saved moving away long bonds disclosed bond experts believe considerable because much lower interest premiums paid on short term debt But market watchers were unsure what affect move on Japanese investors who been snapping up Canadian bonds at record clip because their traditional preference long term financings Bond traders Japanese who purchased record billion dlrs Canadian bonds year adapted to changes by buying longer term provincial issues shifting to medium term issues offered by Ottawa Their Japanese buying over course six months been very much concentrated medium term maturities noted one Canadian bond trader who asked to be identified Yet there some concern shortage could eventually develop bonds mature or more years David Gluskin vice president Nesbitt Thomson Bongard Inc When interest rates finally seem to stopped going down there going to be flood people trying to lock long end everyone be able to get door But bonds analysts at moment interest rates trending down investors appear to welcome change especially greater treasury bill financing The wholesale market treasury bills very active Michael Berry vice president securities firm Walwyn Stodgell Cohran Murray Ltd change also improves receptivity market other borrowers including provincial governments big utilities corporations There doesn t seem to any lack bonds longer end now also may be result any percieved shortage probably been taken up by provincial funding activities commented Berry

reuters.unknown: C G L M T f reute r f AM BRAZIL STRIKES

text.title: BRAZIL STRIKES CAUSE GOVERNMENT MAJOR PROBLEMS
text.author: By Stephen Powell Reuters
text.body: Strikes by Brazil s seamen by petrol station owners four states causing major headaches to government already wrestling debt crisis week ago seamen began their first national strike years union leaders say they seriously affected Brazilian exports by making idle ships On February Brazilian government suspended interest payments on part huge foreign debt following sharp deterioration trade balance Today government faced fresh problem when most petrol station owners Sao Paulo country s industrial heartland three other states closed down to press higher fuel prices There were fears combination two stoppages could lead to serious fuel shortage seamen s leaders say their strike halted ships belonging to state oil company Petrobras Jornal do Brasil newspaper editorial today entitled Dangerous Confrontation From economic point view seamen s strike carries alarming cost grave consequences supply situation country s external trade seamen seeking pct pay rise rejected offers up to pct Later today Higher Labour Tribunal Brasilia due to rule on whether seamen s strike legal But senior official National Merchant Marine Union Jorge Luis Leao Franco told Reuters strike continue regardless tribunal s ruling Labour unrest worsened Brazil following collapse over few months government s Cruzado Plan price freeze Prices been rising at pct month only workers but also businessmen restive Petrol station owners many garages closed indefinitely today Sao Paulo Parana Mato Grosso Mato Grosso do Sul Television reports Parana state capital Curitiba petrol stations were only supplying fuel exceptional cases such as ambulances funeral processions Brazilian garage owners want to be allowed to raise their profits on alcohol fuel petrol sales to cruzados six U S Cents litre cruzados about cents Queues formed at petrol stations Sao Paulo late night as motorists filled up their tanks while they still could Political sources government President Jose Sarney closely following strikes overall fuel supply situation

reuters.unknown: E F RM A f reute r f BC dome pete pressed

text.title: DOME PETE DMP SAID TO BE PRESSED TO SELL ENCOR
text.author: By Larry Welsh Reuters
text.body: Dome Petroleum Ltd under pressure one largest creditors Canadian Imperial Bank Commerce to sell pct stake Encor Energy Corp Ltd energy industry analysts Dome pledged Encor shares as security part debt to Commerce Bank estimated year at Canadian dlrs bank wants Dome to sell stock to pay down debt analysts The Commerce been slowly but surely moving Encor direction might make saleable asset one analyst who asked to be named Dome earlier considering selling Encor Energy but reaffirmed company s pct interest Canadian gold producer Dome Mines Ltd DM up sale at right price Dome now negotiating plan to restructure more than billion dlrs debt sees Encor as strategic investment does intend to sell spokesman David Annesley Encor shares do pay dividends Commerce Bank spokesman also declined comment when asked whether pressing Dome to sell Encor stake At current market prices Dome s stake Encor be valued at dlrs while Dome Mines shares be worth dlrs Recent strength price Encor shares may also prompt Commerce Bank to press Dome to divest holding Canadian oil gas producer analysts Encor s stock price improved quite substantially recent weeks runup crude prices Peters Co Ltd oil analyst Wilf Gobert commented The possibility Commerce Bank like to see sold at these levels because they can get more now than they been able to recent years he added Encor traded earlier on Toronto Stock Exchange at near week high up around six dlrs early February company also recently set up own operating management previously carried out by Dome Petroleum Maison Placements Canada Inc analyst Denis Mote commented Dome Encor are actually going to get farther apart So the sale does make lot sense Mote However analysts Dome resist any moves to divest Encor favor retaining operating assets since sale proceeds likely go directly to pay down Dome s debt to Commerce Bank I think they ll probably try to hang onto Encor as long as they can Bache Securities Inc analyst Doug Weber Some Dome s group major creditors might move to block such sale arguing they claim on company assets Other creditors generally all want to make sure something they might be able to get piece being sold out under them analyst Gobert Another stumbling block be Encor s dlr joint liability loans to Dome Petroleum advanced by Arctic Petroleum Corp Japan Beaufort Sea exploration Analysts similar hurdle could also hinder possible sale Dome Petroleum s interest Dome Mines Dome Mines guaranteed dlrs Dome Petroleum s debt right consent to sale Dome Petroleum s holding Presumably potential buyer Dome Mines shares seek some type relief on company s debt obligations connected Dome Petroleum Gobert Dome spokesman Annesley earlier declined to specify at what price company consider selling Dome Mines shares but current prices more than dlrs share are very attractive

reuters.unknown: A RM f reute r f BC BRAZIL CRISIS SPURS R

text.title: BRAZIL CRISIS SPURS RETHINK OF DEBT STRATEGY
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: Brazil s economic crisis forcing wholesale re examination established strategy dealing developing country debt leading bankers say While finance minister Dilson Funaro unlikely to succeed his attempt at seeking outright political solution to debt problem Brazil s suspension interest payments on billion dlrs commercial bank debt convinced at least some bankers new ideas needed The time come to look at alternatives one seasoned debt rescheduler Even before Brazil s move difficulty syndicating billion dlr financing package Mexico agreed to principle October prompting top bankers to examine way they managing debt crisis Federal Reserve Chairman Paul Volcker too spoke recently debt fatigue need to breathe new life into debt rescheduling procedures There already signs change Japanese banks setting up jointly owned firm to they transfer some LDC loans bid to strengthen their balance sheets improve financial management get tax breaks But bankers move toward greater governmental role be gradual The process such you cannot expect tangible progress short period time one banker Certainly Funaro got frosty reception Washington several European capitals past week when he called on government officials to explain Brazil s crusade political dialogue on debt Assistant U S Treasury Secretary David Mulford instance criticized what he called large scale solutions such as debt forgiveness or creation new multilateral lending agencies While such approaches may some political appeal they impractical ultimately counterproductive Mulford told House subcommittee week He could added any proposal might be construed as bail out U S banks be non starter Congress But bankers Reagan Administration could promote accounting regulatory changes to foster debt equity swaps debt securitization to enable banks to consider interest capitalization as alternative to new loans Experts say government must also make easier banks gradually to write down their third world loan books Mulford his Congressional testsimony urged banks to explore different options The banks should be encouraged to look at so called menu approach he Bankers aim be to keep loan syndicates intact or conversely to allow small banks to write off their exposure way detrimental to major lenders Big banks say unfair small creditors continue to receive interest on old debt even if they do contribute to new loans effect large banks say they making new loans fund interest payments on old debt To solve problem to streamline cumbersome negotiating process Argentina revived idea exit bonds be issued at discount to small creditors exchange their existing debt bankers banks be rid loans but to recognize loss Amid swirl new ideas even role commercial bank advisory committees come under scrutiny principle consensus on panels operate challenged recently when Citibank ironically original architect committee system stubbornly refused time to endorse financing offers to Philippines Chile strains gone unnoticed Washington There does seem to be lot speculation frailty bank advisory committees U S official Brazil s Funaro heavily criticized panels London on Monday charging they unresponsive to new ideas U S banks over represented on them Hannes Androsch chairman Austria s Creditanstalt Bankverein there some truth to charge Sentiment growing Europe we re no longer prepared to bail out U S banks he told reporters New York week While U S bankers obviously see things differently some started to wonder whether advisory committee still right tool job The debt crisis probably evolved beyond capacity commercial banks alone at least some cases one top New York rescheduler But governments unable or unwilling to play larger role bankers see no alternative to advisory committee It s worst form government there apart all others one banker paraphrasing former British prime minister Winston Churchill s opinion democracy

reuters.unknown: RM C f reute u f BC fin futures outlook

text.title: POSITIVE OUTLOOK TEMPERED IN U S DEBT FUTURES
text.author: By Brad Schade Reuters
text.body: Higher oil prices stronger than expected U S employment growth led to sharp losses U S interest rate futures diminished what been positive chart outlook financial analysts increase non farm payroll employment during February above market expectations rise to jobs sparked selling Treasury bond futures drove June contract through key technical support at at opening Friday they noted I don t like fact we close below Prudential Bache analyst Fred Leiner level June bond contract been top three month trading range when penetrated during rally Wednesday led to bullish forecasts by chartists But analysts called false breakout on weekly charts when June bond closed at Friday Some also forecast high week at may signal bearish double top formation portending steep losses I tend to go along double top scenario Northern Futures analyst Eileen Rico Rico noted possible formation along fact rally two weeks bond futures occurred on relatively low volume were negative signals Despite what could be negative chart outlook Leiner remains cautiously optimistic June bonds should find support between next week optimistic outlook as well as Leiner s expectation yield curve flatten near term based on improving inflation outlook dollar stable economic data giving Federal Reserve little room to ease monetary policy the inflation outlook improving Leiner should lead to relatively stronger bond prices than bill Eurodollar prices Still Leiner noted recent rise oil prices remains concern inflation outlook Oil rose during week on reports OPEC nations were maintaining production quotas official prices got extra boost Friday due to suspension oil exports Ecuador after earthquake Thursday The runup crude oil be short lived phenomenon Carroll McEntee McGinley analyst Brian Singer rise text.title: PAPER SAYS INDICTMENTS IN IRAN CASE EXPECTED
text.body: The special prosecutor Iran arms scandal expected to bring indictments could include felony charges against senior Reagan administration officials New York Times reported quoted law enforcement officials knowledge investigation as saying special prosecutor Lawrence Walsh who investigating scandal focusing on three areas paper identified these as conspiracy to defraud government obstructing justice making false statements to government prosecutor ruled out any suspects including current former government officials But paper Walsh his investigation sale arms to Iran diversion funds to U S backed contra rebels Nicaragua running short time because Congress begun granting immunity to key figures affair to speed up congressional investigations paper quoted one official as saying while obstruction justice usually hard to prove evidence cover up may been comically obvious here

only plus to come under some criticism being too conservative they Chiyoda Japan s eighth largest non life insurer Standard Poor s Corp been business more than century while Moody s Investors Service Inc founded more than years ago Each rated some to U S Japanese issues Japanese insurers eager to issue more bonds through overseas financing companies Chiyoda s rating stimulate their interest using U S Agencies analysts Standard Poor s Chiyoda s rating based on strong capitalisation stable performance high levels unrealised appreciation particularly stock portfolio U S Agency also emphasised favourable regulatory environment Japan s non life insurers operate Japanese agencies were shocked by earlier AAA ratings on claims paying ability Sumitomo Life Insurance Co Dai Ichi Mutual Life step into U S Rating market Kazuya Kumura general manager NIS Kyosuke Yoshida managing director Japan Bond Research Institute JBRI Agencies should be more actively used to respond better to growing overseas investor interest Takeshi Watanabe president Japan Credit Rating Agency Ltd JCRA Our advantages we deeper understanding business practices Japan other Asian nations Japanese investor behaviour also more alert quick to react to domestic news JBRI years experience Japan s largest agency other two been business two years Finance Ministry approval yen commercial paper issues by December allowed non residents holding at least rating one agencies to issue samurai shogun euroyen bonds without first meeting normal stringent financial criteria But local companies regardless reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC U S SEEKS MAJOR JAPA

text.title: U S SEEKS MAJOR JAPANESE ECONOMIC CHANGE IN APRIL
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: The United States openly attacked Japan s tight fisted fiscal policy first time warned Tokyo promised economic package April must be significant senior U S Officials high level talks week U S Criticised Japan s overall fiscal policy as deflationary argued fiscal position as dire as says criticism reflects growing feeling among some U S Policy makers Japan s tight fiscal policy frustrating attempts to stimulate domestic demand boost imports U S Attack represents distinct shift by conservative Reagan administration until recently been sympathetic to Tokyo s efforts to reduce government role economy diplomats Pointing out Japan pledged Paris month to take action to boost demand senior U S Treasury official April package must be more than routine Japanese government bureaucrats already they do expect package to contain much more than rehash April s measures means accelerated public investment lower interest rates on government housing loans measures to pass along benefits strong yen to consumers none major immediate economic impact Several Japanese officials agreed real obstacle to stimulating economy fiscal policy pursued by Finance Ministry they welcomed shift U S Policy But they expressed concern move might backfire by fanning resentment against U S Interference domestic affairs Makoto Kuroda vice minister international affairs at Ministry International Trade Industry Japan stimulate economy response to U S Criticism but to meet mounting pressure Japanese businessmen shift U S Policy also causing some nervousness within Reagan administration U S Undersecretary State Economic Affairs Allen Wallis told reporters week U S Does necessarily want increase Japan s budget deficit There many measures Japan could take to stimulate economy he argument new been raised past by Organisation Economic Cooperation Development What new U S Backing position At week s talks Japanese officials they argued Tokyo been able to maintain tight fiscal stance boost economy funds giant postal savings system But Finance Ministry interested enough to ask receive figures supporting new U S Position senior U S Official Other western officials so sure They take time to boost public investment much further as there many projects pipeline Stepped up capital spending help domestic construction companies but much impact on imports they added
